src:
Microsoft razkril, kdaj bo novi Edge s pogonom Chromium bo na voljo za prenos!

06 Nov 2019, 06:37








Novi Microsoft Edge bo na voljo za prenos 15. januarja 2020.

Pri podjetju Microsoft so si dolga leta prizadevali, da jim bo nekega dne končno uspelo biti konkurenčen tudi na trgu spletnih brskalnikov in z novo različico Microsoft Edga optimistično zrejo v prihodnost. Projekt Internet Explorer je dolga leta veljal za pravo malo sramoto in tega so se pri Microsoftu tudi zavedali - in ta problem tudi po njihovih besedah sedaj uspešno naslovili. Novi Edge bo namreč osnovan na odprtokodnem sistemu Chromium podjetja Google. Priljubljen odprtokodni pogon danes v praksi uporablja kar nekaj spletnih brskalnikov, kot so Brave, Opera in Vivaldi. Mozllla in pa Applov Safari sta ena izmed redkih izjem, ki še vedno ostajata pri tem neodvisna in uporabljata svoj lasten pogon.
Nedavno so pri podjetju Microsoft predstavili nov logotip za spletni brskalnik Edge s pogonom Chromium. Ta predstavlja odmik od bolj ali manj stilizirane črke "e", kot se je doslej pojavljala v logotipu spletnega brskalnika Internet Explorer in Edge. Pri novem logotipu za novi Edge dejansko gre za modro-zelen vrtinec, ki sicer še vedno spominja na črko "e", a se oblikovno precej razlikuje od dosedanjih logotipov Microsoftovih brskalnikov.
Še bolj pomembno pa je to, da so pri podjetju Microsoft razkrili, kdaj bo na voljo za prenos končna različica spletnega brskalnika Edge s pogonom Chromium. To se bo zgodilo 15. januarja prihodnjega leta. Pri tem pa je zanimivo to, da bo novi Edge na voljo za vse aktivne operacijske sisteme, vključno z mobilnimi. To pomeni, da ga bomo lahko namestili na operacijske sisteme Windows 10, Windows 8x, Windows 7, macOS, iOS in Android. Več o novem spletnem brskalniku Edge s pogonom Chromium pa bo znanega kmalu.



Povezave: Microsoft
text:
Microsoft announces when the new Chromium-powered Edge will be available for download!

06 Nov 2019, 06:37








The new Microsoft Edge will be available for download on January 15, 2020.

Microsoft has worked for many years to one day finally be competitive in the web browser market, and with the new version of Microsoft Edga they are optimistic about the future. For many years, the Internet Explorer project was considered a bit of a shame, and Microsoft was also aware of it - and now they have successfully addressed this problem, according to them. The new Edge will be based on Google's Chromium open source system. The popular open source drive today is used by quite a few web browsers such as Brave, Opera and Vivaldi. Mozllla and Apple's Safari are one of the few exceptions that still remain independent and use their own drive.
Recently, Microsoft introduced a new logo for the Chromium-powered Edge web browser. This represents a departure from the more or less stylized letter "e" as it appeared so far in the Internet Explorer and Edge web browser logo. The new Edge logo is actually a blue-green swirl, still reminiscent of the letter "e", but much different in design from previous Microsoft browser logos.
More importantly, Microsoft has revealed when the final version of the Chromium-powered Edge web browser will be available for download. It will happen on January 15 next year. The interesting thing is that the new Edge will be available for all active operating systems, including mobile ones. This means we will be able to install it on Windows 10, Windows 8x, Windows 7, macOS, iOS and Android. More about the new Chromium-powered Edge web browser is coming soon.



Links: Microsoft
